snippet: Beetles that attack and kill weak pine trees are reproducing twice a year instead of once as warm temperatures arrive earlier, and millions of trees are dying.
abstract: Study in journal The American Naturalist finds that warming summers have allowed mountain pine beetles to begin reproducing twice a year instead of once, causing an enormous population boost, and devastation to millions of trees across the United States.
lead_paragraph: Beetles that attack and kill weak pine trees are reproducing twice a year instead of once as warm temperatures arrive earlier, and millions of trees are dying.

headline.print_headline: Beetles’ Birth Explosion Puts Trees Under Stress
headline.seo: Beetles’ Birth Explosion Puts Pine Trees Under Stress
headline.main: Beetles’ Birth Explosion Puts Trees Under Stress
